title: How to Connect a Kinect to an Xbox One S

steps.title: Connect the wall plug and cord to the power supply.
steps.content: Connect the wall plug and cord to the power supply. Insert the wall plug from the longest cable that came with the Kinect Adapter kit to your wall, then plug the other end of the cable into the power supply (the box that has one open port on one side; there is another cable with a round plug at the other end).

steps.title: Insert the round connector of the power cable into the Kinect hub.
steps.content: Insert the round connector of the power cable into the Kinect hub. You'll plug it inside the only round port that's on the Kinect hub (the box with three connection ports).

steps.title: Connect the Kinect Sensor cable into the Kinect hub.
steps.content: Connect the Kinect Sensor cable into the Kinect hub. Your Kinect Sensor should have a cable attached to it via USB that should plug into the single port on the hub (it attaches your Kinect to your Kinect hub).

steps.title: Connect the USB 3.0 cable into the USB port labeled "Kinect" on your console.
steps.content: Connect the USB 3.0 cable into the USB port labeled "Kinect" on your console. You'll most likely find this port on the back of the console. The USB 3.0 port is a large square on the Kinect hub. After you've plugged all these in, your Kinect is connected to your Xbox One S.

steps.title: Turn on your console.
steps.content: Turn on your console. You can press the Xbox button on the front of the console or on the controller to turn it on.

steps.title: Press the Xbox button again to open the guide.
steps.content: Press the Xbox button again to open the guide. The Xbox button is the large, circular button in the middle of your controller.

steps.title: Navigate to Settings and press A.
steps.content: Navigate to Settings and press A . You can get to this grey gear icon by pressing the down arrow on the directional pad or pressing the analog thumbstick down.

steps.title: Navigate to All Settings and press A.
steps.content: Navigate to All Settings and press A . You'll usually highlight "All Settings" by default as soon as you enter settings.

steps.title: Navigate to Kinect & devices and press A.
steps.content: Navigate to Kinect & devices and press A . You'll need to navigate down the menu on the left side of your screen by tapping the down arrow on the directional pad or pressing the analog thumbstick down.

steps.title: Press A again.
steps.content: Press A again. As soon as you press A in the previous step, you'll be highlighting "Kinect." Your screen will show you what your Kinect sensor picks up. You can press A to select or deselect the options on the left side of your screen to turn your Kinect on or use your Kinect microphone. If you're experiencing issues with your Kinect's connection, you can use the troubleshooting tips on the right side of the screen. [1] X Research source

steps.title: Press B to leave the Kinect window when you're done.
steps.content: Press B to leave the Kinect window when you're done. When you're satisfied that your Kinect is on, microphone enabled, and positioned correctly, you can leave the Kinect Settings.
